input_text:
BREAKING:  Earlier today Trump claimed that he used trade in order to get India and Pakistan to stop their war.

India just contradicted him, saying that there was "no mention of trade in talks during Operation Sindoor" and "trade wasn’t discussed."

reformatting.result: Trump trade claim India Pakistan war contradiction Operation Sindoor talks trade discussion

news_query_extraction.result: Trump, trade negotiation, India-Pakistan conflict, Operation Sindoor, trade talks

summarization.result:
Here are what other news sources are saying:

1. Business Insider reported that Chinese officials have dismissed President Trump's trade optimism as mere talk, stating that Beijing is not engaged in discussions with the US to ease tensions between the two largest economies. This stance indicates a lack of progress in resolving the ongoing trade war that has impacted global markets.
   Source: [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-trump-trade-talks-latest-state-2025-4)

2. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended Trump's trade policies in an interview with ABC News, highlighting the strategic uncertainty created by the administration to leverage negotiations with other countries. Bessent emphasized the importance of addressing non-tariff trade barriers in trade talks.
   Source: [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/scott-bessent-trump-tariffs-trade-strategic-uncertainty-2025-4)

3. Gizmodo reported on the impact of Trump's tariffs on online shoppers, particularly those using China-based retailers. Customers have faced significant price increases, with some orders seeing import charges that more than double the original cost, attributing these changes to President Trump's trade policies.
   Source: [Gizmodo](https://gizmodo.com/did-i-miss-something-online-shoppers-shocked-as-trump-tariffs-jack-up-prices-145-2000595382)

4. NPR covered U.S. Vice President JD Vance's visit to India, focusing on efforts to avoid U.S. tariffs, negotiate a bilateral trade deal, and strengthen ties with the Trump administration. Vance's visit underscores the importance of trade relations between the two countries amid ongoing trade disputes.
   Source: [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2025/04/21/g-s1-61541/vance-india-visit)

5. Italy's Giorgia Meloni, as the right-wing leader, is set to meet with President Trump, representing the European Union in trade discussions amidst the trade war. Meloni's role as a bridge between the EU and the U.S. highlights the significance of diplomatic efforts to navigate trade tensions.
   Source: [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2025/04/17/nx-s1-5367590/italy-meloni-trump-washington-eu-tariffs)

Here is some relevant discourse on this and related issues on Reddit:

In a Reddit post discussing Trump's offer to help relieve conflict between India and Pakistan,
